shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Samson, no run

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Billings, no run
comm_cricinfo: good length at off stump, walks into the forward defence

wkt_text: SW Billings c †Saha b Sandeep Sharma 0 (3m 2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
comm_cricinfo: gone! Sandeep rewarded for his consistency. This is back of a length in the corridor. He puts half a foot forward but is mostly static as he pushes away from the body to try and run it to third man. Gets a thin outside edge that is no trouble for Saha. No demonstrable movement there, just a good line and length. It's enough
comm_cricbuzz: 0.6    Sandeep Sharma to Billings, out Caught by Saha!! Edged and caught! The perfect start for KXIP, a nothing shot from Billings and he has to take the long walk back to the hut. Sandeep shortened his length outside off and got the ball to shape away slightly, drew Billings into playing at that. He was looking to run it down towards third man, gets a thick edge and it's an easy catch to the keeper. Billings' comeback is a short one, the Daredevils have been rocked early. Billings c Saha b Sandeep Sharma 0(2)

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, defends off the back foot to mid-on

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Samson, FOUR runs
comm_cricinfo: finally hits one in the gap. This isn't off the middle, but the timing, as always, is there. Good length outside off, stands tall and punches it wide of mid-off with a closed bat face
comm_cricbuzz: 2.3    Sandeep Sharma to Samson, FOUR, nicely played by Samson, that should get him going, fraction short and wide of off, he leans forward, plays with a flat-bat and gets it in the gap - wide of extra-cover

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Samson, no run

wkt_text: SV Samson c Sharma b Sandeep Sharma 5 (14m 14b 1x4 0x6) SR: 35.71
comm_cricinfo: it was coming. Samson didn't look comfortable on this pitch after the first few deliveries. The ball has been biting into the pitch and it does so again. Straightens off a length at middle stump. He looks to whip this over midwicket but the deviation means it gets the toe of the bat and balloons up to mid-off
comm_cricbuzz: 2.5    Sandeep Sharma to Samson, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Sandeep has two now and the Daredevils have lost both openers. On a good length and a hint of shape away from outside off, Samson took a step down the track and was looking to work it towards the on-side, closed the bat-face early, gets a thick leading edge - high and towards mid-off. A simple grab by Mohit and Delhi find themselves in early trouble. Samson c Mohit Sharma b Sandeep Sharma 5(14) [4s-1]

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Nair, SIX runs

comm_cricbuzz: 4.4    Sandeep Sharma to Nair, SIX, cracking shot, banged in short and just outside off, Karun was early into the pull and nailed it high and in front of square on the on-side, went soaring over the ropes for a maximum

wkt_text: SS Iyer c & b Sandeep Sharma 6 (9m 7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 85.71
comm_cricinfo: good length outside off stump, he looks to drive on the up but it's the two-paced nature once more. This stops on him and takes the toe of the bat and floats teasingly in front of Sandeep who stays low in his follow-through and dives low to his left with one hand that is perfectly under the ball as he takes it
comm_cricbuzz: 4.6   Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught&Bowled!! That's a spectacular return catch from Sandeep, but Shreyas isn't going anywhere. The third umpire has been called for and the soft signal is OUT. That's as clean as one gets, the decision remains OUT. The Mohali crowd go bonkers as their southern neighbours lose another. Credit must go to the bowler here, he was on his followthrough, bent down low, went with his left hand and pouched a beauty. Coming to the ball, it was a short of a good length delivery outside off, might have stopped on the batsman. Shreyas was early into the drive, went low off the bat and to the left of Sandeep. He moved across on his followthrough, with one-handed and the ball stuck, made sure that it didn't pop out when his elbows hit the ground. Shreyas Iyer c and b Sandeep Sharma 6(7) [4s-1]

comm_cricbuzz: 6.1    Axar to Nair, out Bowled!! Axar has struck first ball and it's been a free-fall for the Daredevils. This was the quicker ball from Axar, pitched on off and went straight on, Karun was playing for a bit of turn, ended up playing inside the line and missed it completely. The ball curled past the outside edge and crashed into the off-stump, Karun looks back in dismay and walks off. DD are in a heap of trouble now. Nair b Axar 11(10) [6s-1]

wkt_text: RR Pant lbw b Maxwell 3 (16m 6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
comm_cricinfo: goes through his defence! This is good length at off, and it slides through with the arm. Pant's bat is angled - it's coming down from the third man direction. And it has come down late. Flicks his front pad which isn't fully forward and that's half the side down
comm_cricbuzz: 7.4    Maxwell to Pant, out Lbw!! The lovely drift of Maxwell has accounted for yet another young Indian batsman. He came from round the wicket, got this one to slide one with the angle, Pant was playing down the wrong line, ended up pushing his bat outside the line of the delivery, gets beaten on ths inside edge and is rapped right in front. The impact was in front of middle-stump, at worst, would have been crashing into leg. Easy call for the umpire and DD continue to slump. Pant lbw b Maxwell 3(6)

comm_cricinfo: full outside off, looks for the expansive drive, beaten on pace. Toe-ended to mid-off

comm_cricinfo: good length, angling down leg side, flicked off his pads to fine leg
comm_cricbuzz: 14.4    Aaron to Mishra, 1 run, too straight and on Mishra's pads, clipped away towards long leg for a single

comm_cricinfo: good length at off stump, comes at him slowly as he defends with hard hands. It lobs up into the off side, safe from all fielders there
comm_cricbuzz: 14.5    Aaron to Rabada, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, stopped on Rabada as he prodded forward. The ball lobbed in the air and fell near the vacant short cover region

comm_cricinfo: dropped. This one is creamed on the up to Shaun Marsh at short extra cover. He gets low to his right quickly and takes it. It pops out of his grasp as his arms hit the floor and he hurriedly tries to pouch it as it bobbles away from him, but can't hold on
comm_cricbuzz: 14.6   Aaron to Rabada, no run, chance and dropped. Shaun Marsh is the culprit, he had two bites at the cherry, but can't hold on. Length delivery outside off, Rabada drilled it towards cover, Marsh tumbled to his right and let the ball slip, he was alert though, turned around and tried to grab the rebound, but can't do so. He had it for a moment, but the ball popped out as his elbows hit the ground

comm_cricinfo: good length, angled down leg side
comm_cricbuzz: 15.1    Sandeep Sharma to Mishra, wide, Sandeep slips one down the leg-side, Mishra was looking to flick and missed, called as a wide

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off, steps out and opens the face to run it to third man
comm_cricbuzz: 15.1    Sandeep Sharma to Mishra, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Mishra comes down the track and steers it towards third man

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Rabada, no run
comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, looks to push to long-on, gets an inside onto boot, it rolls to the keeper after evading off stump
comm_cricbuzz: 15.2    Sandeep Sharma to Rabada, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Rabada gets half-forward and gets an inside edge onto the pads

wkt_text: K Rabada c Marsh b Sandeep Sharma 11 (25m 20b 1x4 0x6) SR: 55.00
comm_cricinfo: Marsh holds on this time. Good length, angled in at off stump. Offers the full face as he shapes to hit this over long-on, but the bat turns slightly as he connects. Only height on this, in the end, no distance. Nice and easy at long-on for Marsh
comm_cricbuzz: 15.3    Sandeep Sharma to Rabada, out Caught by Shaun Marsh!! Another chance for Marsh and this time he holds on, DD's procession continues. On a good length and on the stumps, Rabada was leaning forward on the lofted drive, the bat turned as he made contact, ends up mistiming it high and towards long-on. Marsh has a long time to settle under it and gobbles it up, fourth wicket for Sandeep and he's having quite an evening. Rabada c Shaun Marsh b Sandeep Sharma 11(20) [4s-1]

comm_cricinfo: bouncer at middle stump, doesn't quite come on. He is comfortably behind this as he turns it down to fine leg
comm_cricbuzz: 15.4    Sandeep Sharma to Mishra, 1 run, banged in short and on the stumps, Mishra swivels across and pulls it down towards long leg

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Mohammed Shami, 1 run

comm_cricbuzz: 15.5    Sandeep Sharma to Shami, 1 run, fuller length delivery on Shami's pads, clipped away in front of square on the on-side for a single

comm_cricinfo: slower ball, misfired. Short and well wide of the marker outside off stump
comm_cricbuzz: 15.6    Sandeep Sharma to Mishra, wide, the back of the hand slower ball from Sandeep, Mishra thinks about playing at that but lets it go at the last moment, called as a wide

shortText: Sandeep Sharma to Mishra, no run
comm_cricinfo: full at off stump, driven to mid-off
comm_cricbuzz: 15.6    Sandeep Sharma to Mishra, no run, on a good length and just outside off, driven straight to the fielder at mid-off. That ends Sandeep's work with the ball today, he finishes with career-best figures of 4 for 20

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off stump, turned down to third man off the back foot
comm_cricbuzz: 16.1    Aaron to Shami, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, steered away behind square on the off-side for a single

comm_cricinfo: slower ball, good length at off stump. Looks to flick into the leg side, can only bunt it feebly to midwicket
comm_cricbuzz: 16.2    Aaron to Mishra, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, looked like it stopped on Mishra. He was early on the flick and nearly popped a catch to mid-wicket

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off stump, nicely on top of the bounce but cuts straight to point

comm_cricinfo: full and angled down leg, flicked off his toes to fine leg

shortText: Aaron to Mohammed Shami, no run
comm_cricinfo: short ball outside off stump, looks to ramp this through the slip region, it's too fast for him. Beaten
comm_cricbuzz: 16.5    Aaron to Shami, no run, short and well outside off, Shami was looking to help it on its way and missed

wkt_text: Mohammed Shami c Sandeep Sharma b Aaron 2 (6m 4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00
comm_cricinfo: short ball outside off stump, this time he keeps the ramp out and looks for a full-blooded club over the off side. Once more, too fast for him, and too steep. It's high up, but barely past the circle and Sandeep takes it at extra cover
comm_cricbuzz: 16.6   Aaron to Shami, out Caught by Sandeep Sharma!! Dravid looks distraught in the dug-out as another batsman self combusts. Can't blame Shami though, DD needed some quick runs, but there's nothing coming today. This was short and wide of off, asking to be smacked. Shami had the right idea, he was looking to crack it over point, but the execution went all awry. Ends up getting too underneath the ball and flat-bats it in the air, Sandeep circled around the skier from cover. Thought about going reverse cupped, decides against it and takes it in the normal way. Shami c Sandeep Sharma b Aaron 2(4)

wkt_text: S Nadeem c & b Sharma 0 (2m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
comm_cricinfo: and they won't even get close. Good length, slower ball at middle stump. Pokes at this aimlessly with an angled bat. Gets it high, on the sticker, and it lobs up for Mohit to complete a simple catch
comm_cricbuzz: 17.1   Mohit Sharma to Nadeem, out Caught&Bowled!! DD have been bundled out for their lowest score in IPL - the 10th edition is bringing in some unwanted records for teams. First it was RCB - now it's the DD. Slower ball from Mohit, Nadeem didn't read it at all, popped his bat forward, closed the face on the tuck, got a leading edge and it's an absolute dolly to the bowler. Not sure if the Mohali crowd enjoyed the show from DD - you don't want to watch a mismatch after having paid big money for the tickets. Nadeem c and b Mohit Sharma 0(1)

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Guptill, no run
comm_cricinfo: back of a length at the thigh, misses out on the glance and gets stuck behind the flap before falling onto the pitch
comm_cricbuzz: 0.1    Shami to Guptill, no run, begins with a skiddy back of a length delivery that skids on and thuds Guptill on the thigh pad. The Kiwi tried to get on top of the bounce but failed to do so

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Guptill, no run
comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, on top of the bounce and defended into the off side

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Guptill, FOUR runs

comm_cricbuzz: 0.3    Shami to Guptill, FOUR, Guptill and Punjab are away. Takes a step forward, manufactures his own room and thrashes it over cover. Kings XI anthem blares in the background

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Guptill, no run

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Guptill, no run

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Guptill, FOUR runs
comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, he exposes the stumps and makes enough room to slash this past point
comm_cricbuzz: 0.6    Shami to Guptill, FOUR, Guptill is in a hurry here. Wasting no time as he backs away to this back of a length delivery and bullies it through the packed off-side field. Not so productive start for Shami and DD

comm_cricinfo: good length, angled down the leg side, flicks the pad as it goes through to the keeper

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
comm_cricbuzz: 1.2    Rabada to Amla, no run, sticks to a more staple line and length, good length delivery around off, Amla stands tall and blocks it to cover

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off, mistimed back foot punch, straight to point
comm_cricbuzz: 1.3    Rabada to Amla, no run, shortens his length a touch, no room whatsoever so Amla pats it to point

comm_cricinfo: bouncer outside off is too short, launches upwards after pitching and Amla wants nothing to do with it. Pant has to leap and stretch to hold this
comm_cricbuzz: 1.4    Rabada to Amla, wide, ooh, venomous bounce for Rabada. Dug in on a shortish length and it loops over Amla's head as he sways out of the line. Called a wide for height

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, solidly behind it as he pushes it wide of mid-off
comm_cricbuzz: 1.4    Rabada to Amla, 1 run, Amla gets the scorecard ticking. Angled at 144kph closer to off, Amla punches it to mid-off and hustles through for a quick single

comm_cricinfo: follows him down leg side with a good length ball, the flick shot is cut off by Nadeem at square leg who dives to his right
comm_cricbuzz: 1.5    Rabada to Guptill, 1 run, fine stop from Nadeem, saves some runs for his team. Rabada slants one on leg seeing the batsman move away, Guptill manages to tuck it towards square leg. Nadeem dives to his right and makes a good stop

comm_cricinfo: low full toss at off stump, not too much fuss as he brings down the bat and taps it past extra cover
comm_cricbuzz: 1.6   Rabada to Amla, FOUR, classic shot from Amla. Just a soft push from the crease to this full toss and it roars away to the fence. Beats extra cover, minimum effort there from the mighty Hash!

comm_cricinfo: good length at off stump, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
comm_cricbuzz: 2.1    Chris Morris to Guptill, 1 run, solidly punches it towards mid-off for a single

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, nicely behind this as he defends off the back foot

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, subdued back foot punch, straight to short extra

comm_cricinfo: back of a length outside off stump, unleashes a wrist cut at this, but Rabada gets down quickly to his left at third man

comm_cricinfo: good length at middle stump. This came back in sharply but Amla defended into the off side nicely, with soft hands. Allows Guptill to run through

comm_cricbuzz: 3.4    Rabada to Guptill, FOUR, cheeky and effective for Guptill. Cleverly arches his back on seeing this short ball outside off, opens his bat face and elevates it over first slip. One bounce and into the fence

comm_cricinfo: back of a length at off stump, drops it into the off side to try and steal a single, connects too well
comm_cricbuzz: 3.5    Rabada to Guptill, no run, darting in around off, Guptill waits and neatly defends

comm_cricinfo: low full toss at middle stump. He hasn't hit it too well, but there's enough power to clear mid-off comfortably. He looked to lift this over the mid-off boundary but got it off the outside half of the toe-end
comm_cricbuzz: 3.6    Rabada to Guptill, FOUR, ooh, he didn't time it as he would've liked but still earns himself a boundary. A dipping low full toss from Rabada, Guptill miscued it as he dragged it off the cue-end. Squirts it over mid-off and off it goes away to the fence

comm_cricinfo: good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
comm_cricbuzz: 4.1    Chris Morris to Amla, no run, 137kph, curls back in sharply, Amla is anchored in his crease as he brings his bat down at an angle to smother it

comm_cricinfo: good bouncer outside off, but there's no one deep at square leg. Amla goes for the hook and is hurried on it but it lands safely, halfway between boundary and circle
comm_cricbuzz: 4.2    Chris Morris to Amla, 3 runs, short ball without any purpose, Amla goes for the pull, fetches it over his head, not off the middle and manages to clear mid-wicket. The ball plugs in the outfield and they will come back for the third

comm_cricinfo: this has gone several thousand kilometres away! Back of a length at off stump, clears himself for the big swing by backing away and lifts this cleanly, straight and into the second-tier above the bowler
comm_cricbuzz: 4.3    Chris Morris to Guptill, SIX, Guptill is in overdrive. Wants to capitalise on the powerplay. Stays a bit leg-sidish, loads up big time and smacks it with lot of power to send it soaring into the long-on stands

comm_cricinfo: yorker outside off stump, squeezed into the off side
comm_cricbuzz: 4.4    Chris Morris to Guptill, no run, very full outside off, Guptill crouches low as he squeezes it into the off-side

comm_cricinfo: bouncer at off stump, Guptill takes it on and doesn't connect. But this dips quickly and bounces before it reaches Samson at deep square
comm_cricbuzz: 4.5    Chris Morris to Guptill, 1 run, in the airr and just short of Samson at deepish mid-wicket. Guptill mistimes the pull, ekes it off the top half of the blade and skies it, luckily it drops short of the incoming fielder

comm_cricinfo: full on the pads, flicked gracefully and right off the middle, straight to deep square

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Amla, no run

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Guptill, FOUR runs

shortText: Mohammed Shami to Guptill, FOUR runs

comm_cricinfo: full at leg stump, backs away and pummels a drive to mid-on...where Rabada misfields and gives them fifty for the opening stand

comm_cricinfo: good length at off stump, beats him in flight. He comes forward and offers the pad

comm_cricinfo: good length at middle stump, gets down for the ramp through fine leg, gets a leading edge that lands just in front of short midwicket

comm_cricinfo: tossed up full at middle stump, clears the front leg, clears the midwicket boundary. Old fashioned Guptill slog sweep

comm_cricinfo: good length, angled into leg stump, gets low and sweeps it to long leg where Corey Anderson misfields. Guptill brings up his fifty and finishes this game
comm_cricbuzz: 7.5    Nadeem to Guptill, 1 run, game, set and match - Punjab. What a way to finish the game. Guptill lowers his center of gravity and sweeps it through square leg. He raises his fifty as well. Punjab win by 10 wickets
